Property.preferredDefinition: Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A prostate biopsy collection protocol that consists of sextant cores plus 6 lateral peripheral zone cores.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A prostate biopsy collection protocol that consists of sextant cores plus 2 lateral peripheral zone cores.

Concepts.definition: A prostate biopsy collection protocol that consists of sextant cores plus 2 lateral peripheral zone cores.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: External MRI Ultrasound Fusion Guided Biopsy

ValueMeaning.preferredName: External MRI Ultrasound Fusion Guided Biopsy
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface.: A method for targeted biopsy that merges images captured by multiparametric MRI with real-time ultrasound, creating a synthetic, 3D image, which highlights the suspicious area within the image.

Concepts.definition: Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface.
A method for targeted biopsy that merges images captured by multiparametric MRI with real-time ultrasound, creating a synthetic, 3D image, which highlights the suspicious area within the image.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: National Institutes of Health MRI Ultrasound Fusion Guided Biopsy
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A federal agency in the U.S. that conducts biomedical research in its own laboratories; supports the research of non-Federal scientists in universities, medical schools, hospitals, and research institutions throughout the country and abroad; helps in the training of research investigators; and fosters communication of medical information.
